title: ACDC+ NQIP Clinical QI Dataset - v2.7
description: ACDC+ NQIP Clinical QI Dataset - v2.7

name: ACDCPlusNQIPClinicalQIe

item.text: Correct any errors in the details for Hospitalisation, Pressure Injuries, IAD, Physical Restrictive Practice Intervention, Barthel Index or Body Weight Measurements in the resident's clinical record in AutumnCare and then click 'Repopulate Form' (see the left section of form).
Questions in the form are answered automatically based on the background data but the user can change the answers to those that are not grey-ed out.
Questions that are grey-ed out cannot be changed by the user.
Use the 'Save Progress' operation on the left to save progress on a partially complete form.
Complete the declaration at the bottom of the form to display the resident's status for each QI and CPS Score. A form will not be valid without this declaration.
Click 'Save As Final' on the left panel to complete the review and finalise the form.
Reference date for this review (i.e., 90 days ago)
Resident was absent from the home for the past 90 days (i.e., from the reference date above)?
Resident is receiving end-of-life care (see definition of end-of-life care below)?
End-of-life is the terminal phase of life, where death is imminent and likely to occur within three months. This is sometimes referred to as actively dying.

Inpatient encounter: A patient encounter where a patient is admitted by a hospital or equivalent facility, assigned to a location where patients generally stay at least overnight and provided with room, board, and continuous nursing service.

Emergency: A patient encounter that takes place at a dedicated healthcare service delivery location where the patient receives immediate evaluation and treatment, provided until the patient can be discharged or responsibility for the patient's care is transferred elsewhere (for example, the patient could be admitted as an inpatient or transferred to another facility).
Short stay: An encounter where the patient is admitted to a health care facility for a predetermined length of time, usually less than 24 hours.

valueExpression.name: RestrictivePracticeRepeat
valueExpression.expression: %RestrictivePractice.entry.resource.where(performedDateTime > (today() - 3 days) or performed.start > (today() - 3 days) or performed.end > (today() - 3 days))

item.text: Detailed record of all forms of physical restraint in the past 3 days

valueExpression.name: RestrictivePracticeExclusiveSecureAreaOnlyRepeat
valueExpression.expression: %RestrictivePracticeExclusiveSecureAreaOnly.entry.resource.where(performedDateTime > (today() - 3 days) or performed.start > (today() - 3 days) or performed.end > (today() - 3 days))

valueExpression.name: CPS_Score
valueExpression.expression: iif(%iC1.exists() and %iC2a.exists() and %iD1.exists() and %iG2j.exists(), iif(%iC1 = 5, 6, iif(%iC1 = 4 and (%iG2j = 6 or %iG2j = 8), 6, iif(%iC1 = 4, 5, iif((%iC1 = 0 or %iC1 = 1 or %iC1 = 2 or %iC1 = 3) and (%xcps1 = 2 or %xcps1 = 3), iif(%xcps2 = 2, 4, iif(%xcps2 = 1, 3, 2)), iif(%xcps1 = 1, 1, 0))))), null)

valueExpression.name: CPS_Score_Text
valueExpression.expression: iif(%CPS_Score=0, 'Intact', iif(%CPS_Score=1, 'Borderline intact', iif(%CPS_Score=2, 'Mild impairment', iif(%CPS_Score=3, 'Moderate impairment', iif(%CPS_Score=4, 'Moderate or severe impairment', iif(%CPS_Score=5, 'Severe impairment', iif(%CPS_Score=6, 'Very severe impairment', '-')))))))

item.text: 1. Cognitive skills for daily decision making: Making decisions regarding tasks of daily life-e.g., when to get up or have meals, which clothes to wear or activities to do

valueCoding.display: 0 Independent - decisions consistent, reasonable, and safe
1 Modified independence - some difficulty in new situations only
2 Minimally impaired - In specific recurring situations, decisions become poor or unsafe; cues / supervision necessary at those times
3 Moderately impaired - Decisions consistently poor or unsafe; cues / supervision required at all times
4 Severely impaired - Never or rarely make decisions

item.text: 2. Short-term memory OK - Seems / appears to recall after 5 minutes
3. Making self understood (Expression): Expressing information content - both verbal and non-verbal

valueCoding.display: 1 Usually understood - Difficulty finding words or finishing thoughts BUT if given time, little or no prompting required
2 Often understood - Difficulty finding words or finishing thoughts AND prompting usually required
3 Sometimes understood - Ability is limited to making concrete requests

item.text: 4. Eating - How RESIDENT eats and drinks (regardless of skill). Includes intake of nourishment by other means (e.g., tube feeding, total parenteral nutrition)

valueCoding.display: 0. Independent - No physical assistance, setup, or supervision in any episode
1. Independent, setup help only - Article or device provided or placed within reach, no physical assistance or supervision in any episode
3. Limited assistance - Guided manoeuvring of limbs, physical guidance without taking weight
4. Extensive assistance - Weight-bearing support (including lifting limbs) by 1 helper where person still performs 50% or more of subtasks
5. Maximal assistance - Weight-bearing support (including lifting limbs) by 2+ helpers-OR-weight-bearing support for more than 50% of subtasks
6. Total dependence - Full performance by others during all episodes
8. Activity did not occur during entire period
